The Oatmeal v. FunnyJunk - Copyright & Creativity

The Oatmeal is possibly one of the most creative laugh-out-loud funny (and educational) web-comics I have come across in recent years and it breaks my heart to see Matthew Inman getting ripped off by FunnyJunk. Arstechnica has a great article about FunnyJunk lifting Inman's work with little to no attribution. Be sure to read Matthew's thoughtful and insightful response to the whole ordeal. As a footnote - if you want to see the downfall of human culture in action just look at any internet forum or youtube comment thread.

As an artist I am extremely nervous about my own work being ripped off, but thankfully (or not) I am not well-known enough to have that happen. I have struggled with how to handle copyrighting and watermarking my images to protect my work, however I don't want to treat my tens of readers/viewers like criminals.
